item.title: Compression
item.description: Chapter Three - Compression Coding Variable length codes Assume there is no channel noise - source coding

item.title: Generator Matrices
item.description: A linear code $C$ is a vector space over some field $F$.

item.title: Lecture 03
item.description: Correction Handling $\sum_(j=1->n) a_ij x_j === 0 (mod 2) where i = 1,…,m and a_ij \in {0,1}$

item.title: Introduction to Codes
item.description: Digital Data Transmission (as Maths) Source Alphabet - S = {s1, s1, …, sq} of q symbols Code Alphabet A, consisting of r symbols The radix r is the number of symbols in the code alphabet Probabilities p_i = P(S_i) A code that encodes each symbol s_i by a codeword (string of code symbols) Codewords can be seen as vectors.
